etymology.description: 宀 ‘house’ + 口 ‘mouth’; echoes in a place. Original form of 響; later borrowed to write 𠨍 (嚮). Similar to 冋.
etymology.interpretation: A mouth sounding under a roof evokes reverberation indoors, matching the sense later written as 響 ‘echo, sound’. By rebus borrowing the graph came to write 嚮 ‘to face, toward; direction’, which is the sense carried by modern 向.

examples.chinese: 我们向前走吧(我們向前走吧)。
她向着窗户微笑(她向著窗戶微笑)。
他向医院的方向跑去(他向醫院的方向跑去)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiàng yīyuàn de fāngxiàng pǎo qù.
examples.english: He ran in the direction of the hospital.
